text:
I just did some testing. It isn't my changes from last week. In fact it worked
just fine when I first gave it a try after seeing this bug. I then did a svn
update and a clean rebuild and it failed to work. I know I did a clean build
yesterday, so it is a new problem.
creator: rfrovarp@apache.org

text: I can confirm that observation - a change on line 160 in the default pubs sitemap seems to be the cause of the problem (I currently try to debug)
creator: ragaller@apache.org
ragaller@apache.org
text:
line 160 <map:part src="cocoon:/document-content/{1}/{2}/{3}/{7}"/> fails somehow
line 160 <map:part src="{resource-type:format-xhtml}?rendertype={1}"/> works with regard to bxe

No clue how to debug further - so I leave it for now.
Okay. I see that r589770 is what broke it.
creator: rfrovarp@apache.org
nettings@apache.org
text:
Index: sitemap.xmap
===================================================================
--- sitemap.xmap        (revision 590131)
+++ sitemap.xmap        (working copy)
@@ -107,7 +107,7 @@
       </map:match>
     </map:pipeline>

-    <map:pipeline type="caching">
+    <map:pipeline type="profile-noncaching">

       <map:match pattern="**.rss">
         <map:generate src="{resource-type:format-rss}"/>

now when i look at the profiler, i don't find any call with rendertype "edit"
there, just view. the code that jürgen suspected seems to be perfectly
equivalent to the old code, it's just that rendertype never gets to be "edit",
and iirc that's what causes the bxe_xpath attribute to be set.

to reduce the number of pipeline stages, i tried to request
http://localhost:8888/default/authoring/index.bxe.html directly.
now it looks like the language-exists action is eating the parameter {1} that
should be used for rendertype={1} in line 133f (document-content matcher).
 
if i comment out the action so that the generator is accessed directly,
rendertype is set and the resulting file contains bxe_xpath.
when the action is active, rendertype is empty and hence no bxe_xpath is set.
creator: nettings@apache.org
nettings@apache.org
text:
maybe it's related to the huge number of nested pipelines? andreas has
introduced yet another level of indirection (**.bxe.html --> lenyabody-** -->
lenyabody-raw** --> document-content** --> POOF).
maybe we have triggered a cocoon bug?
